verses.verse: A Psalm<WH4210> of Asaph<WH623>. O God<WH430>, the heathen<WH1471> are come<WH935> into thine inheritance<WH5159>; thy holy<WH6944> temple<WH1964> have they defiled<WH2930>; they have laid<WH7760> Jerusalem<WH3389> on heaps<WH5856>. of: or, for

The dead bodies<WH5038> of thy servants<WH5650> have they given<WH5414> to be meat<WH3978> unto the fowls<WH5775> of the heaven<WH8064>, the flesh<WH1320> of thy saints<WH2623> unto the beasts<WH2416> of the earth<WH776>.
Their blood<WH1818> have they shed<WH8210> like water<WH4325> round about<WH5439> Jerusalem<WH3389>; and there was none to bury<WH6912> them.
We are become a reproach<WH2781> to our neighbours<WH7934>, a scorn<WH3933> and derision<WH7047> to them that are round about<WH5439> us.
How long, LORD<WH3068>? wilt thou be angry<WH599> for ever<WH5331>? shall thy jealousy<WH7068> burn<WH1197> like fire<WH784>?
Pour out<WH8210> thy wrath<WH2534> upon the heathen<WH1471> that have not known<WH3045> thee, and upon the kingdoms<WH4467> that have not called<WH7121> upon thy name<WH8034>.
For they have devoured<WH398> Jacob<WH3290>, and laid waste<WH8074> his dwelling place<WH5116>.

O remember<WH2142> not against us former<WH7223> iniquities<WH5771>: let thy tender mercies<WH7356> speedily<WH4118> prevent<WH6923> us: for we are brought<WH1809> very<WH3966> low<WH1809>. former: or, the iniquities of them that were before us

Help<WH5826> us, O God<WH430> of our salvation<WH3468>, for<WH1697> the glory<WH3519> of thy name<WH8034>: and deliver<WH5337> us, and purge away<WH3722> our sins<WH2403>, for thy name's<WH8034> sake.

Wherefore should the heathen<WH1471> say<WH559>, Where is their God<WH430>? let him be known<WH3045> among the heathen<WH1471> in our sight<WH5869> by the revenging<WH5360> of the blood<WH1818> of thy servants<WH5650> which is shed<WH8210>. revenging: Heb. vengeance

Let the sighing<WH603> of the prisoner<WH615> come<WH935> before<WH6440> thee; according to the greatness<WH1433> of thy power<WH2220> preserve<WH3498> thou those that are appointed<WH1121> to die<WH8546>; thy: Heb. thine arm preserve: Heb. reserve the children of death
And render<WH7725> unto our neighbours<WH7934> sevenfold<WH7659> into their bosom<WH2436> their reproach<WH2781>, wherewith they have reproached<WH2778> thee, O Lord<WH136>.

So we thy people<WH5971> and sheep<WH6629> of thy pasture<WH4830> will give thee thanks<WH3034> for ever<WH5769>: we will shew forth<WH5608> thy praise<WH8416> to all<WH1755> generations<WH1755>. to all: Heb. to generation and generation
